about.title: About
about.html:
Bicycle Route Planner is capable of computing routes for cyclists from an origin to a destination. It solves the multi-criteria bicycle routing problem based on a formal model expressive enough to represent transport network features and cyclists' preferences grounded in the studies of real-world bicycle route choice behaviour. Our solution employs the heuristic-enabled multi-criteria label-setting algorithm together with a combination of heuristic speedups enabling fast query runtimes. We optimise for three criteria: travel time, cycling stress, and physical effort.

Currently, the Bicycle Route Planner is developed by Pavol Žilecký, Jan Hrnčíř, Jan Linka, and Tomáš Fišer under the supervision of Michal Jakob at Agent Technology Center, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague.
